revised_title: On the Molecular Constitution of Organic Bases and Ammonium Alkaloids
tldr: The author, A.W. Hofmann, investigates the molecular constitution of organic bases and introduces a new group of alkaloids called ammonium bases. These bases are formed by the action of alcohol iodides on nitrile bases and have remarkable properties, including strong alkaline reactions and the ability to form soap. The author also discusses the potential for further research in the artificial preparation of natural alkaloids, such as those found in cinchona bark.
